name: CANADIAN PUNK PACK - FIVE RECORDS, ONE PRICE
description:
Five all-time classic Canadian punk singles for one low price and combined postage!

You get:

HOT NASTIES - Invasion Of The Tribbles EP (Calgary, 1980)
ROCK'N'ROLL BITCHES - Wild West EP (Edmonton, 1980)
THE SPYS - Underground 45 (Windsor, 1980)
BUREAUCRATS - Feel The Pain 45 (Ottawa, 1979)
POINTED STICKS - What Do You Want... 45 (Vancouver, 1978)

name: PUNK PACK - FIVE RECORDS, ONE PRICE
description:
Save on postage and pick up five of our purest punk records in one shot at one lower price. You get:

BLITZ - All Out Attack EP
PARTISANS - Police Story 45
DEAD BOYS - Last Stand 1980 EP
COCKNEY REJECTS - Flares 'n Slippers EP
THE BUSINESS - Harry May 45

100% GUARANTEED AGGRO

name: HOT NASTIES EP / POINTED STICKS 45 colour vinyl bundle LIMITED
description: We've just repressed two of the very best early Canadian punk singles in a very limited colour edition of only 100 copies each. The HOT NASTIES legendary 1980 "Invasion of the Tribbles" EP on white vinyl and the POINTED STICKS fantastic 1978 45 debut "What Do You Want Me To Do?" on beautiful opaque blue. Available only as a pair!

name: COCKNEY REJECTS - Flares 'n Slippers EP / THE BUSINESS - Harry May 45 SET
description:
Ugly Pop is very proud to present our latest set of classic punk reissues, this time in the form of two all-time great London streetpunk debuts. Vinyl is in house now, jackets due within the next couple weeks, so all orders will ship immediately upon release. Quantities are limited this time around, so don't sleep on these!

Price includes BOTH records, of course.

COCKNEY REJECTS - Flares 'n Slippers EP
Released on Small Wonder in 1979, this unassuming slab signalled the emergence of a new genre, kickstarting both the Rejects' career and the entire oi movement. Debuting with three tracks of quick, raw and exuberant punk rock clearly inspired by the likes of Cock Sparrer, UK Subs and Sham 69, Cockney Rejects went on to sign with EMI and write a number of all time classics, but this is where it all started. High-quality authorised reissue, taken from the masters and packaged in full colour jacket. (UP043)

THE BUSINESS - Harry May 45
One of the three or four all-time great oi singles, this debut 45 from the seminal skinhead band exploded out of east London in 1981, pairing up two 100% monster street punk tracks and spending three months in the UK indie charts, peaking at #13. The Business have gone on to release many genre classics since, but this will always be their finest moment, and remains essential for fans of pure punk rock. High-quality authorised reissue, taken from the masters and in the iconic original sleeve. (UP044)

name: STIV BATORS' DEAD BOYS - Last Stand 1980 EP
description:
STIV BATORS' DEAD BOYS - Last Stand 1980 EP
When erstwhile DEAD BOYS Stiv Bators and Jimmy Zero decided to give it another shot with a summer 1980 US tour, they assembled a pretty crack backing band-- George Cabaniss (Hammer Damage) on guitar, Frank Secich (Blue Ash) on bass and David Quinton (Mods, Arson) on drums-- and proceeded to take it on the road. Over thirty years later, Quinton has remastered the original excellent-quality board tapes from three of the shows to come up with incendiary takes on all-time American punk rock monsters "Son Of Sam", "Third Generation Nation" and "All This And More". 100% authorised release with four-page insert featuring extensive
liners and unseen pictures! (UP042)

**PLEASE NOTE THAT THE STIV BATORS/DAVID QUINTON SPLIT 45 IS SOLD OUT AND WILL NOT BE REPRESSED -- CHECK OUR DISTRIBUTORS OR YOUR LOCAL SHOP**

name: BLITZ - All Out Attack EP / PARTISANS - Police Story 45
description:
One price for both of these monster punk classics, the first two releases on legendary UK82 label No Future back on the 7" vinyl they were intended for. Completely essential releases for anyone who likes punk rock.

BLITZ - All Out Attack EP (UP038)
Massively influential UK outfit Blitz dropped this four-song beast of a debut in 1981, the first release on definitive UK82 label No Future. Sales quickly out-paced demand and the record went on to shift over 25000 copies. Nonetheless, it's been unavailable in its intended format ever since, and with eBay prices steadily creeping higher, this seemed as good a time as any to reissue it properly. A relentlessly tough slab of raw hardcore punk that sits a lot closer to the likes of Negative Approach and early Agnostic Front than to most of its UK contemporaries, this was a huge favourite of mine as a teenager and I'm truly stoked to be reissuing it-- high-quality pressing in six-panel gatefold sleeve!

PARTISANS - Police Story b/w Killing Machine 45 (UP039)
Devastating first single from these teen Welsh punks, blazing through a quick set of peerless first-generation hardcore. Racing drums, desperate vocals and an absolutely incendiary chainsaw guitar attack make this one for the ages, sounding as every bit as vital and powerful now as it did back then. Another reissue culled from the No Future archives and getting the proper format it deserves for the first time in over thirty years! High quality pressing in repro jacket with insert.

name: STEVE ADAMYK BAND - Monterrey EP
description: Given Adamyk's continuing campaign for world domination, this latest salvo of four tough, catchy punkers really doesn't require much explanation. Anyways, the band's popularity is well-deserved-- these are really well-written, memorable songs, but they're also considerably heavier and rawer than one might expect. Yet another highly recommended Canadian punk rock record in a year that has been full of them. Thanks to Hosehead for this slab, download included.

name: NERVOUS TALK - Introductions EP
description:
My favourite new Canadian single in awhile, this debut features three tracks of top-notch punk rock in the vein of the Marked Men, early Rip Off Records or the tougher '70s melodic bands-- can definitely see this appealing to people who dig The Boys, early Undertones or Protex. Mammoth Cave really hits it out of the park with this debut, and the first press is a measly 300 copies!

Pro Tip: drink a bunch of Czech lagers and play this over and over for a guaranteed Friday night good time.

name: KETAMINES - So Hot! EP
description: One of Canada's most promising weirdpunk outfits teams up with up-and-coming Toronto label Hosehead for the third entry in their 2013 singles series (ie four Ketamines records on four different labels, put them together and the sleeves make one complete piece of brain-damaging psychedelic art!). Three tracks here, infectious, stuttering left-field punk rock in a ridiculous colour sleeve with download card. Way too limited and I'm not sure it'll be repressed, so don't sleep on this one.

name: GROWN-UPS - Spare Time EP
description: A pure punk rock EP in the classic model here-- four quick, energetic songs, dual male/female vocals and a scrappily melodic attack in the best late '70s tradition. The last song on this record is just fantastic, a piledriving mid-tempo rocker based around a really tough yet catchy riff and nicely-executed vocal interplay. Released by Mammoth Cave in a tiny pressing, this is the sort of record that people end up paying far too much for a decade later.

name: ARSON - Not Always About You CD
description:
ARSON – Not Always About You CD
It only took 34 years, but Toronto punk outfit Arson have finally dropped the full-length follow-up to their deservedly acclaimed debut single. Of course, the discerning modern-day record buyer has every right to approach such efforts with a degree of suspicion; all too often, resurrected old punks are prone to returning with either pale imitations of their previous work, or to (understandably) changing dramatically over the intervening decades but (less justifiably) continuing to trade on the same name. That Arson have handily avoided both potential pitfalls is perhaps not entirely surprising-- never a generic three-chord punk band to begin with, Arson always reflected a healthy diet of such respectable pre/proto-punk influences as MC5/Stooges-style Detroit rock and Bowie/T Rex UK glam-- but the strength of this record is still remarkable. There's an impressive diversity at work across the eleven tracks here, but the flow is entirely natural and never feels forced, even as the band evoke the Psychedelic Furs and the New York Dolls, '80s new wave and classic '70s hard rock. That said, no one familiar with my own tastes will be surprised when I say that the title track is my favourite, a high-power Detroit-damaged punk ripper that comes charging out of the starting gate before coughing up the catchiest chorus of a record with no shortage of catchy choruses, then whips out some of the most incendiary lead guitar (and harp!) of the entire set. This one is destined to wind up on a lot of mixes; in 1980, it would have been a hit single that both CFNY and Q107 would be happily playing still.

The production is excellent, with the strong, expressive vocals out front occasionally surrendering the spotlight to some seriously tasty lead guitar, and the rhythm section rock solid throughout....but don't just take my word for it, go buy your own copy!

name: HACKAMORE BRICK - Oh! Those Sweet Bananas 45
description: Hackamore Brick's sole 1970 LP on Kama Sutra remains a much-desired artifact of its era, a primordial expression of seminal proto-punk and early Velvets worship. While there are several great tracks on the LP, it's long been my opinion that Oh! Those Sweet Bananas was criminally over-looked and should really have been a 45 from the start. One of the great lost songs of the period, it's a quick, catchy and instantly addictive burst of NYC garage punk pop at the dawn of the '70s. The flip is a beautiful and memorable slow-burner, and a different take to that on the LP. A slight change of pace for Ugly Pop, but a long-time favourite that anyone with good taste will appreciate. New picture sleeve, one-time-only pressing of 500 copies.

name: HOT NASTIES - Invasion of the Tribbles EP
description:
YES, THIS IS THE ONE COVERED BY PALMA VIOLETS!

At long last, a legitimate reissue of this Calgary band's superb "Invasion of the Tribbles" EP, originally released on the band's own Social Blemish label in 1980. Three tracks of smart, rough and original punk rock bursting with angst, enthusiasm and youthful naivete. Think a provincial Canadian equivalent to Peer Pressure, Tapeworm, Razar, early Television Personalities or the second Now 45. Needless to say, we're very excited to be doing this. (UP027)

name: POINTED STICKS - What Do You Want Me To Do? 45 and BUREAUCRATS - Feel The Pain 45
description:
POINTED STICKS - What Do You Want Me To Do? b/w Somebody's Mom 45
These early Vancouver punks released some pretty great records over their short career, but this 1978 debut will probably remain the classic 45 they'll be best known for. Nothing fancy, art-damaged or vicious here, just two near-perfect blasts of loud, snappy, melodic punk that's inspired countless bands since. Certainly not the rarest or most obscure record, but one that deserves to be readily available to anyone with a taste for quality punk rock singles. Colour pocket sleeve and new insert. (UP036)

BUREAUCRATS - Feel The Pain b/w Grown Up Age 45 
The Bureaucrats only released one 45 and a couple comp tracks during their short career, but this 1980 single is one of the very best-- and rarest-- of all Canadian punk records. Two songs here, recorded in December 1979, and each is a bright star in the early punk/pop pantheon, both surging, memorable tunes delivered with loads of energy and angst. A Canadian counterpart to The Jam, Buzzcocks, Undertones, Clash etc, and genuinely that good! In pocket sleeve with new insert. (UP035)

name: SPYS and ROCK & ROLL BITCHES 7"s on LIMITED COLOUR
description: We've repressed just 100 each of these absolutely classic 1980 Canadian punk singles on colour vinyl (nice opaque, not the cheap crap), so collectors take notice. Available only as a bundle for one postpaid price, these won't be in stores and will have very limited distribution elsewhere, so when they're gone, they're gone!

name: TEN SINGLES PACKAGE
description:
The best deal on the site-- order all TEN of our current in-stock titles for one low price! If you're just catching up now, this is the place to start. You get:

HOT NASTIES – Invasion of the Tribbles EP 
HACKAMORE BRICK - Oh! Those Sweet Bananas! 45
BLITZ - All Out Attack EP
FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE – Domestic Accidents 45
MASTERS APPRENTICES - Undecided 45
COCKNEY REJECTS - Flares 'n Slippers EP
BUREAUCRATS – Feel The Pain 45
THE IN-SECT – I Can See My Love 45
THE BUSINESS - Harry May 45

POINTED STICKS - What Do You Want Me To Do? 45

All guaranteed killer singles, and we're charging exact postage to ensure maximum bang for your postage buck!

name: AUSTRALIAN '66 GARAGE PAIR
description:
***AVAILABLE AGAIN!***

Package deal gets you both of our superb recent Australian garage reissues for one special lower price. Two essential Adelaide '66 punk classics. These are back in stock but already running low and may not be repressed again!

MASTERS APPRENTICES - Undecided 45
THE IN-SECT - I Can See My Love 45

name: 5 x GARAGE 45 REISSUE SET
description:
We've recently reissued five excellent '60s garage 45s, all of which are receiving rave reviews everywhere, so it made sense to bundle all five together at one special price for anyone wishing to scoop the whole batch-- a wise choice for anyone who digs essential '60s sounds. Raw garage punk blasts, wild freakbeat fuzz monsters and sublime psych, it's all here, at a lower price and with combined postage anywhere we ship to!

You get:

MASTERS APPRENTICES - Undecided 45 (Australia '66)
THE IN-SECT - I Can See My Love 45 (Australia '66)
NORTHWEST COMPANY - Hard To Cry 45 (Canada '67)
BENT WIND - Sacred Cows 45 (Canada '69)
A PASSING FANCY 45 (Canada '66)

ALL TITLES BACK IN STOCK AND SHIPPING NOW!

name: THE IN-SECT - I Can See My Love 45
description: Prefering to release records in sets, it made perfect sense to couple the Masters reissue with this similarly brilliant classic Australian 45. Hailing from the same city of Adelaide, The In-Sect almost unbelievably released this sophomore single just a few months earlier, in August of '66. I Can See My Love is a stunning rush of '60s punk aggression, all streamlined attack powered by excellent high-speed drumming, piercing guitar and tough, commanding vocals. We've replaced the original's more commercially-minded flip with a wild take on the timeless Yardbirds hit. High-quality pressing from proper master and new picture sleeve.

name: FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE - colour vinyl bundle
description:
We only put together 25 of these sets, so when they're gone, they're gone!

For one price, you get all three colours of the FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE - Domestic Accidents 45, an essential synthpunk debut from members of the SADIES, SHADOWY MEN ON A SHADOWY PLANET, CRASH KILLS FIVE, FUCKED UP, LEFT FOR DEAD, THE CURSE and more!

***LESS THAN TEN SETS LEFT***

name: MASTERS APPRENTICES - Undecided 45
description:
***AVAILABLE AGAIN!***

Australia's legendary Masters Apprentices debuted with this superb 45 in November 1966, hitting hard with Undecided's raucous, early-Kinks-inspired punk R&B but truly achieving godhead with the flipside. Wars Or Hands Of Time is about as good as it gets, a sublime, driving garage-psych gem later to be immortalized on the Nuggets 2 boxset. Among my all-time top five or ten singles, and an absolute dream to reissue. High-quality pressing taken from the recent Aztec remaster, in full-colour jacket with all-new insert.

name: ROCK'N'ROLL BITCHES - Wild West EP
description: While their name remains known to few outside the rabid record collector cogniscenti world-wide, this legendary Alberta outfit came barrelling out of Edmonton in 1980 with just this one near-perfect-- and very limited-- record before imploding and disappearing for evermore....but what a record it was. Coming across like nothing so much as a super-charged version of the first Teenage Head LP, these punks amped up the energy and aggression without sacrificing an ounce of their inherent raw tunefulness and swagger. Legitimately one of the greatest Canadian punk/rock'n'roll records ever released, and back in print for the first time in over thirty years! (UP029) *ALSO INCLUDES SECOND LARGE INSERT NOT SHOWN!*

name: BENT WIND - Sacred Cows 45
description:
Bent Wind's 1970 LP “Sussex” is perhaps the rarest Canadian record there is, but before dropping that massive set of heavy psych, they debuted with a small-run 45 that hit hard with a pair of considerably more straight-forward garage psych rockers. Released on the tiny local Trend label in 1969, this is a very good single that marks the transition from mid-'60s garage to the heavier rock to come. New sleeve and insert made with full cooperation of the band!

DOWN TO LAST COPIES

THIRD PRESS SOON

name: THE SPYS - Underground 45
description: Hailing from the unlikely locale of Windsor, Ontario, just across the river from Detroit, this crew of youthful punks managed to cough up yet another classic Canadian 45 in 1980. Nothing arty or pretentious here, and definitely nothing remotely "post-" about their brand of tough but catchy punk rock, which strikes that ideal balance between adolescent aggro and irresistible hooks. One of the toughest Canadian singles to find, but here's your chance to scoop a copy without having to cut back on the month's groceries. Comes with both original sleeve designs and unseen photos! (UP028)

name: A PASSING FANCY - I'm Losing Tonight 45
description:
One of the all-time great Toronto singles, this actually had decent
local chart success in early '67. The hit's a high-energy slice of
quick-paced freakbeat elevated to greatness by an absolutely stinging lead guitar attack, while the eponymous flipside delivers an insistent mid-tempo jangle built around a haunting chorus. Utterly essential for those who dig classic mid '60s garage sounds. Remastered with a brand new picture sleeve and insert.

name: NORTHWEST COMPANY - Hard To Cry 45
description:
Vancouver's legendary Northwest Company released a fair number of records, but nothing touched this impossible-to-find 1967 debut for
sheer roughness. Hard To Cry is a wild, fast punk screamer with nasty
proto-metal riffing and a caveman rhythm section and the flip's a
similarly aggressive pounder with some serious frustration bleeding
through. Clearly inspired by the toughest early Kinks and Who 45s,
this is one of the most very sought after of all Canadian garage
records, but now's your chance to pick up a high-quality, authorized
reissue with excellent remastered sound and brand new sleeve.

DOWN TO LAST COPIES, ONLY AVAILABLE IN BUNDLES. 

THIRD PRESS SOON

name: FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE - Domestic Accidents 45 *GREEN VINYL*
description:
New project from Don (SHADOWY MEN ON A SHADOWY PLANET, CRASH KILLS FIVE) and Dallas (THE SADIES). Assaultive, disjointed thrash with guitar and bass backed by programmed drums and synths, different vocalists on each song. First 45 features Damian (FUCKED UP) and Amanda Schenk on side A, Chris Colohan (LEFT FOR DEAD, CURSED) and Mickey Skin (THE CURSE) on the flip.

Limited to 200 on opaque green vinyl.

name: ARSON - Coho! Coho! 45
description: ARSON was Toronto's first punk rock supergroup, formed by members of the Viletones, The Ugly and The Poles to deliver raw, tough punk rock as other parts of the early scene veered off to power pop or new wave. Self-released in 1979 and never repressed, this excellent 45 has long been a fave of world-wide collectors, but is just now once again available for the rest of us. Topside's a great fast-paced punker with wild guitar action, backed with a slow-burning creepycrawl monster that compliments it beautifully. Limited one-time repress with faithfully reproduced packaging and new insert! (UP025)

name: FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE - Domestic Accidents 45 *WHITE VINYL*
description:
New project from Don (SHADOWY MEN ON A SHADOWY PLANET, CRASH KILLS FIVE) and Dallas (THE SADIES). Assaultive, disjointed thrash with guitar and bass backed by programmed drums and synths, different vocalists on each song. First 45 features Damian (FUCKED UP) and Amanda Schenk on side A, Chris Colohan (LEFT FOR DEAD, CURSED) and Mickey Skin (THE CURSE) on the flip.

Limited to 200 on opaque white vinyl.

name: FILTHY GAZE OF EUROPE - Domestic Accidents 45 *RED VINYL*
description:
New project from Don (SHADOWY MEN ON A SHADOWY PLANET, CRASH KILLS FIVE) and Dallas (THE SADIES). Assaultive, disjointed thrash with guitar and bass backed by programmed drums and synths, different vocalists on each song. First 45 features Damian (FUCKED UP) and Amanda Schenk on side A, Chris Colohan (LEFT FOR DEAD, CURSED) and Mickey Skin (THE CURSE) on the flip.

Limited to 200 on opaque red vinyl.

name: VANCOUGAR - Naughty 45
description: First single from this esteemed Vancouver band culls two of the finest songs from their otherwise CD-only full-length;  A-side's a timeless, raw garage pop blast guaranteed to stick in your head for months, while the flip's an equally engaging slice of infectious punk rock. These songs were far too good not to see vinyl, so here they are at last, etched in black wax and delivered to you, the consumer, in a handy and attractive dustsleeve.  Out of print, quantities very limited!

name: CRASH KILLS FIVE - What Do You Do At Night? EP
description:
CRASH KILLS FIVE - What Do You Do At Night? EP
CRASH KILLS FIVE exploded onto the Toronto punk scene with this self-released EP in the summer of 1980, blasting through three tracks of supremely catchy punk rock that perfectly balanced memorable song-writing with quick tempos and raw guitar attack, clearly inspired by early Ramones, Diodes and early Buzzcocks. A planned 12" follow-up was never released, as the band split up soon after, with members going on to early hardcore outfit Young Lions and legendary surf-punk band Shadowy Men On A Shadowy Planet, leaving behind only this very collectible single. Faithful reconstruction of original artwork plus detailed new insert with tons of info for punk history geeks like us. (UP024)

name: DREAM DATES - Surfer Joe 45
description:
***LAST COPIES***

DREAM DATES - Surfer Joe 45
The final single from this excellent Hamilton band, culled from the same 1979 session that gave us their "Moans on the Phone" and "Mess You're In" 45s. A-side's a ripping rendition of a lesser-known Surfaris number, while the flip attacks Freddie Cannon's "Tallahassee Lassie" in similar fashion, all blazing, dirty guitars, sneering vocals and amphetamine pace. If you heard the first two singles, you know what to expect-- pure late '70s North American-style punk rock in the vein of Dead Boys, Heartbreakers, Teenage Head and The Users. Not technically a reissue, but it sure fits the theme. 500 press, black vinyl, no gimmicks. (UP023)

name: WHITE WIRES - Pogo Til I Puke 45
description: Ottawa garage punk band's great 2010 single. Officially out of print, but I'm putting five up here to get this Big Cartel thing started!

name: SHEARING PINX / MUTATORS split 12"
description:
Spastic thrash and deceptively chaotic freakout
droolery from two bands that stand out in Vancouver's
exploding neo-no wave/art-damaged punk scene with a
degree of focus and aggression often aspired to but
very rarely achieved. SHPX deliver one long, wailing
psych-punk epic while the Mutators blaze through five
shocks of discordant hardcore that come across like
Void meets No New York. UP020

LONG OUT PRINT AND VERY LIMITED QUANTITY!
